recipe.title: Banana Bread
recipe.description: Moist, sweet bread perfect for breakfast or snacking

steps.descr: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F), grease a loaf tin
steps.instructions: Preheat oven to 175°C (350°F), grease a loaf tin

on_enter.say: Right, let's preheat the oven to one hundred seventy-five degrees celsius, that's about three hundred fifty degrees fahrenheit. And don't forget to grease your loaf tin so nothing sticks!

steps.descr: Mix mashed banana with melted butter
steps.instructions: Mix mashed banana with melted butter

on_enter.say: Now, let's mix those lovely mashed bananas with the melted butter. It should smell absolutely delicious already!

steps.descr: Stir in sugar, egg, and vanilla
steps.instructions: Stir in sugar, egg, and vanilla

on_enter.say: Great! Now let's stir in the sugar, crack in the egg, and add a splash of vanilla. Give it a good mix until it's all combined.
Now, sprinkle in the baking soda and a pinch of salt. These will help our bread rise beautifully.

steps.descr: Fold in flour until just combined
steps.instructions: Fold in flour until just combined

on_enter.say: Let's gently fold in the flour now. Be careful not to overmix - just until it's all combined.

steps.descr: Pour into tin and bake 50-60 minutes
steps.instructions: Pour into tin and bake 50-60 minutes

on_enter.say: Brilliant! Pour the mixture into your prepared tin and pop it in the oven. We'll bake it for fifty to sixty minutes. Your kitchen will smell amazing!

steps.descr: Cool in tin 10 minutes, then on a wire rack
steps.instructions: Cool in tin 10 minutes, then on a wire rack

on_enter.say: Fantastic! Let the bread cool in the tin for ten minutes, then transfer it to a wire rack to cool completely. This will help it firm up nicely.

notes.text: The riper the bananas, the better. Add walnuts or chocolate chips for variety. Test with a skewer - it should come out clean.
